executable.title: Split Label Values
executable.description: This is a CLI module with the goal of spliting label values following an additive rule. This could be useful to separate determined areas of the original label map in different constant values, e.g. brain hemispheres.
executable.contributor: Antonio Carlos da S. Senra Filho (University of Sao Paulo)
executable.acknowledgements: This work was partially funded by CNPq grant ...

image.name: splitLabel
image.label: Split Label
image.description: Split label is a label that defines how the input label volume should be splitted. For instance, it could be used for brain hemispheres separations which the input image could be the whole brain segmentation and the split label is a label map indicating one hemisphere.

integer.name: labelSideA
integer.label: Side A Value
integer.description: Indicates the additive value that will be placed in the side A of the split label.

integer.name: labelSideB
integer.label: Side B Value
integer.description: Indicates the additive value that will be placed in the side B of the split label.

boolean.name: doKeepSomeValues
boolean.description: Choose if you want maintain some label values found in the input label map.
boolean.label: Keep Some Label Values

integer-vector.name: keepSideA
integer-vector.label: Keep Label (Side A)
integer-vector.description: Defines what values in side A that should keep the original value. NOTE: The background value is always maintaned as zero!

integer-vector.name: keepSideB
integer-vector.label: Keep Label (Side B)
integer-vector.description: Defines what values in side B that should keep the original value. NOTE: The background value is always maintaned as zero!
